feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 12:05PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER THIS COMING WEEK... Conditions remain dry across Southeast Alaska and temperatures will rise to the upper 70s across much of the region over the next few days. Fine fuels are dry and there is a risk of camp fires getting out of control. Winds will remain light, which is a mitigating circumstance working in our favor.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton. .Rainfall amounts of one to three inches across southwestern central Indiana over the last week has produced minor flooding on parts of the lower White River. The river have crested and will continue to fall into Tuesday.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 11:06PM CDT until May 30 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SALINE COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 1115 PM CDT... The storms which prompted the warning have weakened below severe limits, and no longer pose an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with these thunderstorms.
